It only makes sense that it would also change as the audiences that are being targeted, and the platforms on which they use social media, do. If your business is still operating under a strategy that's quite similar to social media marketing in the pre-2010 era, it's time for you to get out of the Prehistoric Age, and move into the future.

In addition, a report by the same company found that 74% of marketers say that social media has helped them personally connect with customers.

If your business is still operating under a strategy that's quite similar to social media marketing in the pre-2010 era, it's time for you to get out of the Prehistoric Age, and move into the future.

Social media marketing can be done for many different platforms and can range from very simple to complex. Social media have proven to be a valuable source of traffic for many websites. For instance, according to a HubSpot 2010 Survey, 72% of marketers use social media for content distribution. In addition, a report by the same company found that 74% of marketers say that social media has helped them personally connect with customers.

Today, a successful company must have a strong and growing social media presence in order to compete and survive in our modern world.
